pDescr: The Holmes compact ceramic heater will let you add warmth exactly where you need it! With overheat and manual user-reset safety features, you can confidently use your portable heater with peace of mind. This heater includes two heat settings, with 1500 maximum wattage. Easy to adjust manual controls. Integrated carry-handle & lightweight design. Small footprint uses less space. Fan-only setting. White.
rText: I use it in my office for a few minutes at a time to take the chill out - and to get me out of my seat every half hour or so to put it on again. The on-off switch is not well located so it requires one hand to hold the heater and the other to turn the switch. Other than that it works well. I'm not sure about its durability but I'll find out in time. It doesn't get over-heated but it also doesn't put out a lot of heat.
rTitle: It doesn't get over-heated but it also doesn't put out a lot of heat.

pDescr: The Holmes compact ceramic heater will let you add warmth exactly where you need it! With overheat and manual user-reset safety features, you can confidently use your portable heater with peace of mind. This heater includes two heat settings, with 1500 maximum wattage. Easy to adjust manual controls. Integrated carry-handle & lightweight design. Small footprint uses less space. Fan-only setting. White.
rText:
I love this little heater during the coldest of days. I am a person who gets overheated easily so I often struggle with having to turn on and off heaters to keep comfortable. This little heater however heats up just enough without making me feel like I left it on too long. I use it in a smallish room, about 30ftx20ft or so. It heats this room up fine while I sit at my computer working on daily tasks. The nice thing is there are two settings for how hot you want it. I find that the first heat setting is just right, while the second will heat the room up much faster but then it tends to overheat and eventually the safety kicks in and will turn the fan off. Im not sure if that is normal or if mine just has some issue but I like the fact that it shuts off when it gets hot regardless of the reason.

The best part of the first heat setting too is that it won't burn your toes off. I like to keep it under the desk right beside me so as it slowly heats my room up at a comfortable pace, my feet instantly feel wonderful, like they're being wrapped in a blanket fresh out of the dryer. Ok, I kinda love this little guy. Eventually it will heat your feet up too much, but that's direct heat on you for 30 minutes or so, which isn't recommended by any means. There is also another setting for when it becomes a bit too stuffy, the fan. Now, the fan part of this doesn't really cool the room off at all. To me, its more of a nice air circulator to push around the warmth when it gets a little warmer than your liking.

I am literally using this little heater right now and enjoying writing this review in comfort.
rTitle: Best little heater for your toes and smaller rooms.

rText:
Was very very quiet...for the first week. I think NOT using Fan Only for 30 seconds when cooling down before turning off maybe helped the noise come on and a lack of fan grease from Chinese factory but of course. (Designed Obsolescence).Will re grease myself when out of warranty.
Is very powerful heat on high and a good low heat too. Simple, Effective and Cheap.
One thing is if used on floor dog hair can get into back fan crate so watch for that. And I put mine on a thin concrete board too.

Update 1-7-2017 Still works fine a year later and quiet enough. Seems to be Available for cheapest in the spring though as a Cheap Heater when its the best heater I've had. Thermostats never work right anyways when they are 5 inches from heater so why have one? Don't need a remote, stays fixed on counter without rolling around. After watching a guy fix a ceramic heater on YT I am Sold on the safety of these should the fan quit.
rTitle: Cool it down with Fan Only to extend life.

Easy to adjust manual controls. Integrated carry-handle & lightweight design. Small footprint uses less space. Fan-only setting. White.
rText: Oh my gosh can this thing heat up a room! Small and compact, so obviously easy to carry from room to room. Looking for a great little space heater! This is the one for you!

rText:
OK, I would love this thing but the problem is that often their "patented, technologically advanced, safety system" overheat sensor trips as soon as I start it up, even though it's been resting for 20 minutes and unplugged with no sensor tripping beforehand. So I have to wait a while to start it again if it will even start! :(
I prefer the Pelonis and Lasko heaters now!

pDescr: The Holmes compact ceramic heater will let you add warmth exactly where you need it! rText:
Got this at Target for $20. It's incredibly effective and heats up really quickly for such a tiny thing. I'd liken the size to a gallon of milk.

I can't tell a huge difference between the low and high settings, but the low setting is plenty for keeping me warm while at my desk. I'm taking away stars, though, because it's quite loud. Sure, maybe I'll get used to it over time, but the box indicates a "low" loudness rating, which led me to believe it would be a lot quieter than this. As it is, on the low heat setting, it sounds like a fan on medium speed. For quiet heat, I'm considering buying a dish heater because those are silent.
rTitle: Good value (when $20) for effective and small heater

pDescr: The Holmes compact ceramic heater will let you add warmth exactly where you need it! rText: This heater blows so hot on the high setting that I'm concerned about its safety. I was wearing a gold/metal bracelet while sitting near it, and suddenly I realized my wrist was burning. I would not leave it running near anything that could burn (or otherwise be damaged), and I would not leave it around for unsuspecting people to use without warning. That said, the heater does keep me warm. My favorite feature is that the fan blows slightly up, so if you're sitting in a chair near it, you (not just your feet) get warm.

rText: Man, this little heater is awesome. I originally bought this heater for my desk at work as I am typically really cold in the winter but I also suffer from Raynaud's so my hands will freeze very quickly and go numb when triggered from the cold. I keep this bad boy on my desk and have the hot air blow on my hands. You know how some surfaces get much colder than others? Like desks and such? This really helps with that problem while keeping your room warm. I have actually purchased one for home as well. The only thing is that the front metal grill gets hot so if you happen to want to warm your hands by it you need to be careful not to brush the metal on accident. Take it from me. It doesn't feel good.
rTitle: Small heater that packs a real punch.

I have dropped it plenty of times and it is still working perfectly fine. I use it my bedroom, which is a large room. I also use it my restroom and sometimes the heat becomes unbearable. But that just shows how powerful this little thing is.

pDescr: The Holmes compact ceramic heater will let you add warmth exactly where you need it! With overheat and manual user-reset safety features, you can confidently use your portable heater with peace of mind. This heater includes two heat settings, with 1500 maximum wattage. Easy to adjust manual controls. Integrated carry-handle & lightweight design. Small footprint uses less space. Fan-only setting. White.
rText:
Now that the weather has cooled, I finally got a chance to try my new heater. Here's what I like: It's light weight, it has a hand hold in the back for easy handling, and most importantly, it's toasty warm. It doesn't over heat and shut off like my old heater did, so I'm really happy about that. Also, I like that the outer casing remains cool (but of course the metal grill where the hot air comes out is warm to the touch).

There are 3 things that I wish this heater included: An automatic shut- off if the unit is tipped over, oscillation, and the option to set it at a specific temperature and have it turn itself on and off to maintain that temperature in the room. Those options are probably asking too much for an inexpensive little heater like this. All in all I am very satisfied and would recommend this little box heater to anyone who works in a chilly office.

This circulates the air from the fan rather than blowing it straight out. If you want it to heat a room, it's perfect. If you just like the low heat blowing, this is not the one.

rText: This little heater does its job. My wife is in a private room in a small Alzheimers assisted living facility. The heating and cooling is uneven throughout the building. This heater will knock the chill off her room in about ten minutes. The directions say do not use the heater in a bathroom. Well, I didnt know that till I read the directions, and to heat the bathroom was one of my priorities. Now, I place the heater just outside the door, blowing warm air into the bathroom. This works fine; the small bathroom with shower heats well in about ten to fifteen minutes.

rText: I bought this little heater because a friend had one that I used while he was gone on vacation. It cranks out the heat. Has two settings but I always use the most powerful one. The only thing I don't like about it is there is no auto shut off. I have to bend down to the floor to switch it off or unplug it. The upside is, its powerful for such a small ceramic heater and warms a fairly large area.
rTitle: Powerful Heat in a Small Package

pDescr: The Holmes compact ceramic heater will let you add warmth exactly where you need it! With overheat and manual user-reset safety features, you can confidently use your portable heater with peace of mind. This heater includes two heat settings, with 1500 maximum wattage. Easy to adjust manual controls. Integrated carry-handle & lightweight design. Small footprint uses less space. Fan-only setting. White.
rText:
I love this little heater.
My last one of this specific model I had for 6 years. Used under my desk at work to warm my feet. So it ran basically all late Fall/Winter/early Spring, everyday for sometimes 8 hours a day. It was always used on the 1 setting (because setting 2 would blow breakers in the office).
Only the past few days did it start to die out and not blow anymore heat.
I'm so happy I found the same model still available. I just got my new one and I'm hoping to get another 6 years out of this one.
Features: * It does not have auto shut off if it tips (which honestly I didn't want because I use it as a foot rest). *It does have an overheat safety function. * VERY quiet. No one can tell when I have it on under my desk.
Very happy with this heater. Its simple, has a decent heat output, and so far with this model, I definitely got my money's worth of use.

*Update/Side note = This heater runs at 1000W on low setting and 1500W on high setting. I just read in the instructions that this unit draws 12.5 on HIGH setting. It recommends not using any other high wattage appliances on the same outlet/circuit to avoid overloading. Just though I'd add that in here in case anyone wanted to know.
rTitle: This little guy is a workhorse!

rText: My little bathroom heater died at the tail end of winter, so there were none to be found locally-thank goodness for amazon! This is just a basic little heater, with a turn knob for the different heat levels, but I prefer that to the digital ones with a million settings (a different one I've used, you had to push buttons about 8 times to turn it off- too many settings!). Works great, gets VERY hot- be careful if using around carpet, furniture etc. Perfect for keeping the bathroom comfortable in winter.

rText: Nice flat surface on the base, won't tip over. Has three settings: off... warm... hot. Easy to move around, has a finger hold cut out area on the back at the top. Warms up a small room...like a cold bathroom covered in tile....fast. I like it.
rTitle: Doesn't tip over, warms up a room fast, seems safe, easy to move around. I Like it!
rUser: Lisa A in San Diego, CA
